Column: ACLED count events with specific actors (acled_prx_count)
Long description: Event count of the following: MILITARY VERSUS RIOTERS (e.g. suppression of a demonstration by police or military), MILITARY VERSUS PROTESTERS (e.g. suppression of a demonstration by police or military), REBELS VERSUS RIOTERS (e.g. spontaneous violence against a rebel group; a violent demonstration engaging a rebel group), REBELS VERSUS PROTESTERS (e.g. violence against protesters by rebels), POLITICAL MILITIA VERSUS RIOTERS (e.g. violent demonstration against a political party; spontaneous violence against a political party), POLITICAL MILITIA VERSUS PROTESTERS (e.g. peaceful demonstration engaging a political party), COMMUNAL MILITIA VERSUS RIOTERS (e.g. violent demonstration against an identity militia; spontaneous violence against an identity militia), COMMUNAL MILITIA VERSUS PROTESTERS (e.g. peaceful demonstration engaging an identity militia)
Short description: Event count including the following actors: military, rioters, protesters, rebels, political militia or communal militia.
Source: Raleigh, C., & Dowd, C. (2015). Armed conflict location and event data project (ACLED) codebook.
Transformations prior to data ingestion: Aggregation of events with interaction codes (see ACLED codebook): 15, 16, 25, 26, 35, 36, 45, 46

Column: ACLED fatalities including several actors (acled_prx_fat)
Long description: Number of fatalities from events including the following: MILITARY VERSUS RIOTERS (e.g. suppression of a demonstration by police or military), MILITARY VERSUS PROTESTERS (e.g. suppression of a demonstration by police or military), REBELS VERSUS RIOTERS (e.g. spontaneous violence against a rebel group; a violent demonstration engaging a rebel group), REBELS VERSUS PROTESTERS (e.g. violence against protesters by rebels), POLITICAL MILITIA VERSUS RIOTERS (e.g. violent demonstration against a political party; spontaneous violence against a political party), POLITICAL MILITIA VERSUS PROTESTERS (e.g. peaceful demonstration engaging a political party), COMMUNAL MILITIA VERSUS RIOTERS (e.g. violent demonstration against an identity militia; spontaneous violence against an identity militia), COMMUNAL MILITIA VERSUS PROTESTERS (e.g. peaceful demonstration engaging an identity militia).
Short description: Number of fatalities including the following actors: military, rioters, protesters, rebels, political militia or communal militia.
Source: Raleigh, C., & Dowd, C. (2015). Armed conflict location and event data project (ACLED) codebook.
Transformations prior to data ingestion: Aggregation of events with interaction codes (see ACLED codebook):

Column: ACLED protest event count (acled_pr_count)
Long description: A protest is defined as a public demonstration in which the participants do not engage in violence, though violence may be used against them. Events include individuals and groups who peacefully demonstrate against a political entity, government institution, policy, group, tradition, businesses or other private institutions. Events that are not coded as protests are symbolic public acts such as displays of flags or public prayers (unless they are accompanied by a demonstration), protests in legislatures such as parliamentary walkouts or MPs staying silent, strikes (unless they are accompanied by a demonstration), and individual acts such as self-harm actions (e.g. individual immolations or hunger strikes). Protesters are noted by generic terms (e.g. ‘Protesters (Country)’); if representing a group, the name of that group is recorded in the respective associated actor column. The following sub-event types are associated with the ‘Protests’ event type: ‘Peaceful protest’, ‘Protest with intervention’, and ‘Excessive force against protesters’.
Short description: Protest event count
Source: Raleigh, C., & Dowd, C. (2015). Armed conflict location and event data project (ACLED) codebook.

Column: ACLED sum of fatalities for government regain of territory (acled_bat_gov_fat)
Long description: State forces are defined as collective actors that are recognised to perform government functions, including military and police, over a given territory. Government actors are named by ACLED as a series of separate regimes rather than a uniform body (e.g. Congo/Zaire (1965-1997), Democratic Republic of Congo (1997-2001), and Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) as opposed to Congo/Zaire (1962-present)). As the strength, capacity and policies of governments can vary widely from one regime to the next, ACLED designates governments by their leading regimes. This enables researchers to capture the differences in government involvement and reaction to violence.
Short description: Sum of fatalities (battle-related deaths) for government regain of territory
Source: Raleigh, C., & Dowd, C. (2015). Armed conflict location and event data project (ACLED) codebook.

Column: ACLED sum of fatalities for rebel overtake of territory (acled_bat_reb_fat)
Long description: Rebel groups are defined as political organizations whose goal is to counter an established national governing regime by violent acts. Rebel groups are named according to the title they publicly use to represent themselves. The designation as a rebel group means that the group has a stated political agenda for national power (either through regime replacement or separatism), are acknowledged beyond the ranks of immediate members, and use violence as their primary means to pursue political goals.
Short description: Sum of fatalities (battle related deaths) for rebel overtake of territory
Source: Raleigh, C., & Dowd, C. (2015). Armed conflict location and event data project (ACLED) codebook.

Column: ACLED transformed into non-state fatalities category (acled_ns_fat)
Long description: Fatality count from the event types "battle" and "remote violence", where non of the actors are civilians or military forces (i.e., rebel groups and militias).
Short description: Non-state conflict fatality count
Source: Raleigh, C., & Dowd, C. (2015). Armed conflict location and event data project (ACLED) codebook.

Column: ACLED transformed into one sided violence fatalities (acled_os_fat)
Long description: Fatality count from the event types "battle" and "remote violence", where one actor is civilians.
Short description: One sided violence fatality count
Source: Raleigh, C., & Dowd, C. (2015). Armed conflict location and event data project (ACLED) codebook.
Transformations prior to data ingestion: Aggregation of fatalities from the event types "battle" and "remote violence", where one actor is civilians.

Column: ACLED transformed into state based violence count (acled_sb_count)
Long description: State based conflict events count from the event types "battle" and "remote violence", where one actor is a military force and non of the involved actors are civilians.
Short description: State based conflict events count
Source: Raleigh, C., & Dowd, C. (2015). Armed conflict location and event data project (ACLED) codebook.
Transformations prior to data ingestion: Aggregation of events from the types "battle" and "remote violence", where one actor is a military force and non of the involved actors are civilians.

Column: ACLED transformed into state-based violence category (acled_sb_fat)
Long description: Fatality count from the event types "battle" and "remote violence", where one actor is a military force and non of the involved actors are civilians.
Short description: State-based conflict fatality count
Source: Raleigh, C., & Dowd, C. (2015). Armed conflict location and event data project (ACLED) codebook.
Transformations prior to data ingestion: Aggregation of fatalities from the event types "battle" and "remote violence" where one actor is a military force and non of the involved actors are civilians.

Column: Cuntry GW CODE (country.gwcode)
Long description: Gleditsch and Ward individual country ID codes
Short description: Gleditsch and Ward country ID
Source: Raleigh, C., & Dowd, C. (2015). Armed conflict location and event data project (ACLED) codebook.

Column: FAOSTAT % of childern under 5 who are overweight (pct_und5_overweight)
Long description: Percentage of overweight (weight-for-height more than 2 standard deviations of the WHO Child Growth Standards median) among children aged 0-5 months.
Short description: Percentage of children under 5 years of age who are overweight (modelled estimates) (percent)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT % of children under 5 affected by wasting (pct_und5_wasting)
Long description: Wasting prevalence is the proportion of children under five whose weight for height is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59 months.
Short description: Percentage of children under 5 years affected by wasting (percent)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT % of children under 5 who are stunted (pct_und5_stunted)
Long description: Percentage of stunting (height-for-age less than -2 standard deviations of the WHO Child Growth Standards median) among children aged 0-59 months.
Short description: Percentage of children under 5 years of age who are stunted (modelled estimates) (percent)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT % of population using at least basic drinking water services (pct_pop_basicdrink)
Long description: This indicator encompasses both people using basic water services as well as those using safely managed water services. Basic drinking water services is defined as drinking water from an improved source, provided collection time is not more than 30 minutes for a round trip. Improved water sources include piped water, boreholes or tubewells, protected dug wells, protected springs, and packaged or delivered water.
Short description: Percentage of population using at least basic drinking water services (percent)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT % of population using at least basic sanitation services (pct_pop_basicsani)
Long description: The percentage of people using at least basic sanitation services, that is, improved sanitation facilities that are not shared with other households. This indicator encompasses both people using basic sanitation services as well as those using safely managed sanitation services. Improved sanitation facilities include flush/pour flush to piped sewer systems, septic tanks or pit latrines; ventilated improved pit latrines, compositing toilets or pit latrines with slabs.
Short description: Percentage of population using at least basic sanitation services (percent)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT % of population using safely managed drinking water services (pct_pop_safedrink)
Long description: The percentage of the population using drinking water from an improved water source which is located on premises, available when needed and free from faecal and priority chemical contamination. The percentage of the population using drinking water from an improved water source which is located on premises, available when needed and free from faecal and priority chemical contamination.
Short description: Percentage of population using safely managed drinking water services (Percent)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT % pf population using safely manage sanitation services (pct_pop_safesani)
Long description: The percentage of the population using improved sanitation facilities which are not shared with other households and where excreta are safely disposed in situ or transported and treated off-site.
Short description: Percentage of population using safely managed sanitation services (Percent)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT Agricultural water withdrawal as % of total renewable water resources (agr_withdrawal_pct)
Long description: Water withdrawn for irrigation in a given year, expressed in percent of the total renewable water resources (TRWR). This parameter is an indication of the pressure on the renewable water resources caused by irrigation.
Short description: Agricultural water withdrawal as % of total renewable water resources [%]
Source: AQUASTAT Glossary, FAO, 2019. FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT annual renewable water resources per capita (renewable_pcap)
Long description: Total annual renewable water resources per inhabitant
Short description: Total annual renewable water resources per capita [m3/inhab/year]
Source: AQUASTAT Glossary, FAO, 2019. FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT avarage supply of protein of animal origin (faostat_fsec_cy)
Long description: National average protein supply (expressed in grams per caput per day). It includes the following groups: meat; offals; animal fats and products; milk and products; eggs, fish, seafood and products; and acquatic products, other. The indicator is calculated in three year averages, to reduce the impact of possible errors in estimated DES, due to the difficulties in properly
Short description: Average supply of protein of animal origin (g/cap/day), (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT average annual quantity of groundwater leaving the country (groundwater_export)
Long description: Average annual quantity of groundwater leaving the country, without treaties. It refers to water leaving to other countries, NOT the water that is flowing to the sea for countries located next to the sea.
Short description: Average annual quantity of groundwater leaving the country (total) [10^9 m3/year]
Source: AQUASTAT Glossary, FAO, 2020. FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT average dietary energy supply adequacy (avg_adequate_diet)
Long description: The indicator expresses the Dietary Energy Supply (DES) as a percentage of the Average Dietary Energy Requirement (ADER). Each country's or region's average supply of calories for food consumption is normalized by the average dietary energy requirement estimated for its population to provide an index of adequacy of the food supply in terms of calories. The indicator is calculated in three year averages, to reduce the impact of possible errors in estimated DES, due to the difficulties in properly accounting of stock variations in major food. It thus provides an indicator of structural food supply adequacy.
Short description: Average dietary energy supply adequacy (percent), (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT average protein supply (avg_protein_pcap_day)
Long description: National average protein supply (expressed in grams per caput per day). The indicator is calculated in three year averages, to reduce the impact of possible errors in estimated DES, due to the difficulties in properly accounting of stock variations in major food.
Short description: Average protein supply (g/cap/day), (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT average value of food production (avg_fprod_value)
Long description: The indicator expresses the food net production value (in constant 2014-16 international dollars), as estimated by FAO and published by FAOSTAT, in per capita terms. The indicator is calculated in three year averages, to reduce the impact of possible errors in estimated production, due to the difficulties in properly accounting of stock variations in major food.
Short description: Average value of food production (constant 2014-2016 I$/cap), (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT cereal import dependency ratio (pct_cereal_import)
Long description: The cereals imports dependency ratio tells how much of the available domestic food supply of cereals has been imported and how much comes from the country's own production. It is computed as (cereals imports - cereals exports)/(cereals production + cereals imports - cereals exports) * 100 Given this formula the indicator assumes only values <= 100. Negative values indicate that the country is a net exporter of cereals. The indicator is calculated in three year averages, to reduce the impact of possible errors in estimated production and trade, due to the difficulties in properly accounting of stock variations in major food.
Short description: Cereal import dependency ratio (percent) (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT consumer price food indices (faostat_cpi_cm)
Long description: The Food CPI measures the change over time in the general level of prices of food and non-alcoholic beverage items that households acquire, use or pay for consumption. This is done by measuring the cost of purchasing a fixed basket of consumer food and beverage of constant quality and similar characteristics, with the products in the basket being selected to be representative of households’ expenditure during a specified period. Base year 2015.
Short description: Consumer Price food Indices (%) base year 2015
Source: FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT consumer price general indices (consumer_prices_general_indices)
Long description: Consumer price indices (CPIs) measure changes over time in the general level of prices of consumer goods and services that households acquire, use or pay for consumption. This is done by measuring the cost of purchasing a fixed basket of consumer goods and services of constant quality and similar characteristics, with the products in the basket being selected to be representative of households’ expenditure during a year or other specified period.
Short description: Consumer Price General Indices (%) base year 2015
Source: FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT food price inflation (food_price_inflation)
Short description: Food Price Inflation (%) base year 2015
Source: FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT freshwater withdrawal (fresh_withdrawal_pct)
Short description:
Freshwater withdrawal as % of total renewable water resources [%]

##Long description
Total freshwater withdrawn in a given year, expressed in percentage of the total renewable water resources (TRWR). This parameter is an indication of the pressure on the renewable water resources. It was the Millennium Development Goal (MDG) Indicator 7.5, from which the Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) indicator 6.4.2 is derived with the introduction of Environmental Flow Requirements.
Source: AQUASTAT Glossary, FAO, 2019. FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT gross domestic product ppp (gdp_pc_ppp)
Long description: GDP per capita based on purchasing power parity (PPP). PPP GDP is gross domestic product converted to international dollars using purchasing power parity rates. An international dollar has the same purchasing power over GDP as the U.S. dollar has in the United States. GDP at purchaser's prices is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. Data are in constant 2017 international dollars.
Short description: Gross domestic product per capita, PPP, dissemination (constant 2017 international $)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT indutrial water use efficiency (ind_efficiency)
Long description: MIMEC value added per unit of water used for the MIMEC sector, expressed in USD/m3 with MIMEC including mining and quarrying; manufacturing; electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply; constructions (ISIC B, C, D and F).
Short description: Industrial Water Use Efficiency [US$/m3]
Source: FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT internal renewable water resources per capita (renewable_internal_pcap)
Long description: Total annual internal renewable water resources per inhabitant
Short description: Total internal renewable water resources per capita [m3/inhab/yr]
Source: AQUASTAT Glossary, FAO, 2019. FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT irregated agricultural water use efficiency (irr_agr_efficiency)
Long description: Agricultural value added per unit of water used for the agriculture sector, expressed in USD/m3 with agriculture including livestock, aquaculture and irrigated crops. SDG 6.4.1.
Short description: Irrigated Agriculture Water Use Efficiency [US$/m3]
Source: FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT mean of prices (mp_price)
Long description: The producer's price is the amount receivable by the producer from the purchaser for a unit of a good or service produced as output minus any VAT, or similar deductible tax, invoiced to the purchaser. It excludes any transport charges invoiced separately by the producer.Time series refer to the national average prices of individual commodities comprising all grades, kinds and varieties, received by farmers when they participate in their capacity as sellers of their own products at the farm gate or first-point-of-sale.
Short description: The aggregated mean of wheat, sugar, meat and milk prices (USD/tonne)??
Source: FAO. 2020 Food Outlook - Biannual Report on Global Food Markets: June 2020. Food Outlook, 1. Rome. https://doi.org/10.4060/ca9509en FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT meat price (meat_price)
Long description: The producer's price for meat is the amount receivable by the producer from the purchaser for a unit of a good or service produced as output minus any VAT, or similar deductible tax, invoiced to the purchaser. It excludes any transport charges invoiced separately by the producer.Time series refer to the national average prices of individual commodities comprising all grades, kinds and varieties, received by farmers when they participate in their capacity as sellers of their own products at the farm gate or first-point-of-sale. Price and Index annual time series starting from 1991; Price monthly time series starting from January 2010. Base period code: 2015=100
Short description: Producer price meat (USD/tonne)
Source: FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT milk price (milk_price)
Long description: The producer's price for milk is the amount receivable by the producer from the purchaser for a unit of a good or service produced as output minus any VAT, or similar deductible tax, invoiced to the purchaser. It excludes any transport charges invoiced separately by the producer.Time series refer to the national average prices of individual commodities comprising all grades, kinds and varieties, received by farmers when they participate in their capacity as sellers of their own products at the farm gate or first-point-of-sale. Price and Index annual time series starting from 1991; Price monthly time series starting from January 2010. Base period code: 2015=100
Short description: Producer price milk (USD/tonne)
Source: FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT number of moderately or severely food insecure people (pop_modsevere_finsecurity)
Long description: Estimated number of people living in households classified as moderately or severely food insecure. It is calculated by multiplying the estimated percentage of people affected by moderate or severe food insecurity (I_2.7) by the total population.
Short description: Number of moderately or severely food insecure people (million) (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT number of people undernourished (pop_undernourished)
Long description: Estimated number of people at risk of undernourishment. It is calculated by applying the estimated prevalence of undernourishment to total population in each period. Estimated number of people at risk of undernourishment. It is calculated by applying the estimated prevalence of undernourishment to total population in each period.
Short description: Number of people undernourished (million) (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT number of severely food insecure people (pop_severe_finsecurity)
Long description: Estimated number of people living in households classified as severely food insecure. It is calculated by multiplying the estimated percentage of people affected by severe food insecurity (I_2.5) by the total population.
Short description: Number of severely food insecure people (million) (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT per capita food supply variability (pcap_fsupply_var)
Long description: Per capita food supply variability corresponds to the variability of the "food supply in kcal/caput/day" as disseminated in FAOSTAT.
Short description: Per capita food supply variability (kcal/cap/day)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT percentage of arable land equpped for irrigation (pct_arable_land)
Long description: Ratio between arable land equipped for irrigation and total arable land. Arable land is defined as the land under temporary agricultural crops (multiple-cropped areas are counted only once), temporary meadows for mowing or pasture, land under market and kitchen gardens and land temporarily fallow (less than five years). The abandoned land resulting from shifting cultivation is not included in this category. Data for arable land are not meant to indicate the amount of land that is potentially cultivable. Total arable land equipped for irrigation is defined as the area equipped to provide water (via irrigation) to the crops. It includes areas equipped for full and partial control irrigation, equipped lowland areas, pastures, and areas equipped for spate irrigation. The indicator is calculated in three year averages, to reduce the impact of possible errors in estimated land.
Short description: Percent of arable land equipped for irrigation (percent) (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT political stability and absence of violence/terrorism (pol_stability)
Long description:
Political stability and absence of violence measures perceptions of the likelihood that the
government will be destabilized or overthrown by unconstitutional or violent means, including
politically-motivated violence and terrorism.
Short description: Political stability and absence of violence/terrorism (index)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT prevalence of anemia among women of reproductive age (prev_repr_anemia)
Long description: Prevalence of anemia among women of reproductive age refers to the combined prevalence of both non-pregnant with haemoglobin levels below 12 g/dL and pregnant women with haemoglobin levels below 11 g/dL.
Short description: Prevalence of anemia among women of reproductive age (15-49 years)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT prevalence of exclusive breastfeeding infants 0-5 months (prev_infrant_bfeed)
Long description: Exclusive breastfeeding refers to the percentage of children less than six months old who are fed breast milk alone (no other liquids) in the past 24 hours.
Short description: Prevalence of exclusive breastfeeding among infants 0-5 months of age in percentage
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT prevalence of low birthweight (prev_lowbweigth)
Long description: Low birthweight is defined as a weight at birth of less than 2 500 grams (less than 5.51 lbs), regardless of gestational age.
Short description: Prevalence of low birthweight (percent)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity (pct_modsevere_finsecurity)
Long description: An estimate of the percentage of people in the population who live in households classified as severely food insecure. The assessment is conducted using data collected with the Food Insecurity Experience Scale or a compatible experience-based food security measurement questionnaire (such as the HFSSM). The probability to be food insecure is estimated using the one-parameter logistic Item Response Theory model (the Rasch model) and thresholds for classification are made cross country comparable by calibrating the metrics obtained in each country against the FIES global reference scale, maintained by FAO. A household is classified as severely food insecure when at least one adult in the household has reported to have been exposed, at times during the year, to several of the most severe experiences described in the FIES questions, such as to have been forced to reduce the quantity of the food, to have skipped meals, having gone hungry, or having to go for a whole day without eating because of a lack of money or other resources. The indicator is calculated, at the country level, as a three-year average, to reduce the impact of excess sampling variability due to small size of the samples used for many countries.
Short description: Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the total population (percent) (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT prevalence of obesity in adult population (prev_adult_obesity)
Long description: Prevalence of obesity in the adult population is the percentage of adults ages 18 and over whose Body Mass Index (BMI) is more than 30 kg/m2. Body Mass Index (BMI) is a simple index of weight-for-height, or the weight in kilograms divided by the square of the height in meters.
Short description: Prevalence of obesity in the adult population (18 years and older)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT prevalence of severe food insecurity (pct_severe_finsecurity)
Long description: The prevalence of severe food insecurity is an estimate of the percentage of people in the population who live in households classified as severely food insecure. The assessment is conducted using data collected with the Food Insecurity Experience Scale or a compatible experience-based food security measurement questionnaire (such as the HFSSM). The probability to be food insecure is estimated using the one-parameter logistic Item Response Theory model (the Rasch model) and thresholds for classification are made cross country comparable by calibrating the metrics obtained in each country against the FIES global reference scale, maintained by FAO. A household is classified as severely food insecure when at least one adult in the household has reported to have been exposed, at times during the year, to several of the most severe experiences described in the FIES questions, such as to have been forced to reduce the quantity of the food, to have skipped meals, having gone hungry, or having to go for a whole day without eating because of a lack of money or other resources. The indicator is calculated, at the country level, as a three-year average, to reduce the impact of excess sampling variability due to small size of the samples used for many countries.
Short description: Prevalence of severe food insecurity in the total population (percent) (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT prevalence of undernourishment (pct_undernourished)
Long description: The prevalence of undernourishment expresses the probability that a randomly selected individual from the population consumes an amount of calories that is insufficient to cover her/his energy requirement for an active and healthy life. The indicator is computed by comparing a probability distribution of habitual daily dietary energy consumption with a threshold level called the minimum dietary energy Requirement. Both are based on the notion of an average individual in the reference population. The indicator is calculated in three year averages, from  2000-02 to 2019-21, to reduce the impact of possible errors in estimated DES, due to the difficulties in properly accounting of stock variations in major food.
Short description: Prevalence of undernourishment (percent) (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT producer wheat price (wheat_price)
Long description: The wheat producer's price is the amount receivable by the producer from the purchaser for a unit of a good or service produced as output minus any VAT, or similar deductible tax, invoiced to the purchaser. It excludes any transport charges invoiced separately by the producer.Time series refer to the national average prices of individual commodities comprising all grades, kinds and varieties, received by farmers when they participate in their capacity as sellers of their own products at the farm gate or first-point-of-sale.
Short description: Producer price wheat (USD/tonne)
Source: FAO. 2020 Food Outlook - Biannual Report on Global Food Markets: June 2020. Food Outlook, 1. Rome. https://doi.org/10.4060/ca9509en FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT rail lines density (rail_density)
Long description: Rail lines density corresponds to the ratio between the length of railway route available for train service, irrespective of the number of parallel tracks (rail lines, total route in km) with the area of the country.
Short description: Rail lines density (total route in km per 100 square km of land area)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT services water use efficiency (services_efficiency)
Long description: Services sector value added (ISIC E and ISIC G-T based on rev. 4) divided by water used for distribution by the water collection, treatment and supply industry (ISIC 36), expressed in USD/m3 with services including all the service sectors
Short description: SDG 6.4.1. Services Water Use Efficiency [US$/m3]
Source: FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT share of dietry energy supply derived from cereal, roots and tubers (kcal_pcap_day_cerotu)
Long description: The indicator expresses the energy supply (in kcal/caput/day) provided by cereals, roots and tubers as a percentage of the total Dietary Energy Supply (DES) (in kcal/caput/day) calculated from the correponding countries in the FAOSTAT food balance sheets. The indicator is calculated in three year averages, to reduce the impact of possible errors in estimated DES, due to the difficulties in properly accounting of stock variations in major food.
Short description: Share of dietary energy supply derived from cereals, roots and tubers (kcal/cap/day) (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT sugar price (sugar_price)
Long description: The sugar producer's price is the amount receivable by the producer from the purchaser for a unit of a good or service produced as output minus any VAT, or similar deductible tax, invoiced to the purchaser. It excludes any transport charges invoiced separately by the producer. Time series refer to the national average prices of individual commodities comprising all grades, kinds and varieties, received by farmers when they participate in their capacity as sellers of their own products at the farm gate or first-point-of-sale. Price and Index annual time series starting from 1991; Price monthly time series starting from January 2010. Base period code: 2015=100
Short description: Producer price sugar (USD/tonne)
Source: FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT total dam storage capacity per capita (dam_cap_pcap)
Long description: Total dam storage capacity per capita. Total cumulative storage capacity of all large dams. The value indicates the sum of the theoretical initial capacities of all dams, which does not change with time.
Short description: Total dam storage capacity per capita [m3/inhab]
Source: AQUASTAT Glossary, FAO, 2019. FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT value of food import (pct_fimport_merch)
Long description: Value of food (excl. fish) imports over total merchandise exports. The indicator is calculated in three year averages, to reduce the impact of possible errors in estimated trade flows.
Short description: Value of food imports in total merchandise exports (percent) (3-year average)
Source: The Suite of Food Security Indicators presents the core set of food security indicators. FAO data: https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT water stress (water_stress)
Long description: Freshwater withdrawal as a proportion of available freshwater resources. It is the ratio between total freshwater withdrawn by all major sectors and total renewable freshwater resources, after taking into account environmental flow requirements. SDG 6.4.2.
Short description: Freshwater withdrawal as a proportion of available freshwater resources, Water Stress [%]
Source: AQUASTAT Glossary, FAO, 2018. FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: FAOSTAT water use efficiency (general_efficiency)
Long description: Value added per unit of water used expressed in USD/m3 SDG 6.4.1.
Short description: Water Use Efficiency [US$/m3]
Source: FAO. [2022]. AQUASTAT Core Database. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Database accessed on [2022/01/22]. https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP

Column: IMF WEO % change in GDP (ngdp_rpch_tcurrent)
Long description: Annual percentages of constant price GDP are year-on-year changes; the base year is country-specific. Expenditure-based GDP is total final expenditures at purchasers' prices (including the f.o.b. value of exports of goods and services), less the f.o.b. value of imports of goods and services. Time (t) is based on the report released in October and April every year from 2007.
Short description: Annual percentage change of Gross domestic product, constant prices – current
Source: The World Economic Outlook (WEO) database

Column: IMF WEO % change in GDP time -1 (ngdp_rpch_tmin1)
Long description: Annual percentages of constant price GDP are year-on-year changes; the base year is country-specific. Expenditure-based GDP is total final expenditures at purchasers' prices (including the f.o.b. value of exports of goods and services), less the f.o.b. value of imports of goods and services. Time (t) is based on the report released in October and April every year from 2007.
Short description: Annual percentage change of Gross domestic product, constant prices – t minus 1
Source: The World Economic Outlook (WEO) database

Column: IMF WEO forecasted % change in GDP time + 1 (ngdp_rpch_tplus1)
Long description: Forecasted annual percentages of constant price GDP are year-on-year changes; the base year is country-specific. Expenditure-based GDP is total final expenditures at purchasers' prices (including the f.o.b. value of exports of goods and services), less the f.o.b. value of imports of goods and services. Time (t) is based on the report released in October and April every year from 2007.
Short description: Forecasted annual percentage change of Gross domestic product, constant prices – t plus 1
Source: The World Economic Outlook (WEO) database

Column: IMF WEO forecasted % changed in GDP time + 2 (ngdp_rpch_tplus2)
Long description: Predicted annual percentages of constant price GDP are year-on-year changes; the base year is country-specific. Expenditure-based GDP is total final expenditures at purchasers' prices (including the f.o.b. value of exports of goods and services), less the f.o.b. value of imports of goods and services. Time (t) is based on the report released in October every year from 2007.
Short description: Annual percentage change or forecasted annual percentage change of Gross domestic product, constant prices – t plus 2
Source: The World Economic Outlook (WEO) database

Column: REIGN number of months the leades has been in power (tenure_months)
Long description: Counts the number of months the leader has been in power in his or her present spell. The inauguration month takes a value of 1. tenure resets every time a leader leaves and reenters office.
Short description: Number of months the leader has been in power in his or her present spell.
Source:
Bell, Curtis, Besaw, Clayton., Frank, Matthew. 2021. The Rulers, Elections, and Irregular Governance (REIGN) Dataset. Broomfield, CO: One Earth Future. Available at https://oefdatascience.github.io/REIGN
.github.io/

Column: UCDP "best estimate" of fatalities from non-state conflict (ged_ns_best_sum_nokgi)
Long description: The best (most likely) estimate of the total number of fatalities, disaggregated for non-state conflict per the Uppsala Conflict Data Program (UCDP) [definitions](https://www.pcr.uu.se/research/ucdp/definitions/) in the UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (UCDP GED) and the UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate).
Short description: The best (most likely) estimate of the total number of fatalities from non-state conflict as per the UCDP definition.
Source:
UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (UCDP GED) and UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate), variable best.

Davies et al. 2022. Organized violence 1989-2021 and drone warfare. Journal of Peace Research 59(4); Sundberg & Melander. 2013. Introducing the UCDP Georeferenced Event Dataset. Journal of Peace Research 50(4).
Transformations prior to data ingestion: Nokgi = No imputation (single or multiple) was made for the known geographic imprecision problem, i.e. events that do not have precise locations recorded by UCDP (see Croicu and Hegre, 2019).
